@sylphx/webgpuWebGPU for Node.js & Bun

Modern, lightweight alternative to Dawn. Built with Rust + wgpu.

Get Started
View on GitHub

Lightning Fast

Built with Rust and wgpu. 50x smaller binary (1.7MB vs 50-150MB), 18x faster build times.

ðŸŽ¯

Simple & Modern

Clean API, TypeScript definitions, works with Node.js 18+ and Bun 1.0+. No complex build tools needed.

Easy to Use

Quick Start â€‹

bash
npm install @sylphx/webgpu
1
bash
bun add @sylphx/webgpu
1
bash
pnpm add @sylphx/webgpu
1

Simple Example â€‹

javascript
const { Gpu } = require('@sylphx/webgpu')

async function main() {
  // Create GPU instance
  const gpu = Gpu.create()

  // Request adapter
  const adapter = await gpu.requestAdapter()
  console.log('GPU:', adapter.getInfo().name)

  // Request device
  const device = await adapter.requestDevice()

  // Ready to use WebGPU!
  console.log('WebGPU ready!')
}

main()

Why This Library? â€‹

Feature@sylphx/webgpu@kmamal/gpu (Dawn)
Build Time5-15 minutes1-3 hours
Binary Size~1.7MB50-150MB
DependenciesCargo onlydepot_tools (1GB) + Dawn (8GB)
Implementationwgpu (Rust)Dawn (C++)
Platform Support18+ via napi-rsLimited prebuilts

Features â€‹

  • âœ… GPU Compute - Run shaders on GPU for parallel computation
  • âœ… Rendering - Triangle, textured quads, MSAA, depth testing
  • âœ… Textures - Upload, download, sampling, all formats
  • âœ… Render Bundles - Reusable command recording
  • âœ… Indirect Draw/Dispatch - GPU-driven rendering
  • âœ… Query Sets - Timestamp queries for profiling
  • âœ… TypeScript - Full type definitions included
